isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - POWER STEERING PUMP: VICKERS (LUK) V10NF AND V20NF - INSPECT

svcproc.title: INSPECT
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 8 for all Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Discard the used shaft seal (Item 8) and all O-rings (Items 3 and 15). Wash the metal parts in mineral oil solvent, blow them dry with compressed air and place them on a clean surface for inspection.

Check the wearing surfaces of the body (Item 7), pressure plate (Item 4), ring (Item 16) and rotor (Item 17) for scoring and excessive wear. Remove light score marks by lapping. Replace any heavily scored or badly worn parts.
Inspect the vanes (Item 5) for burrs, wear and excessive play in the rotor (Item 17) slots. Replace the rotor and vanes if the slots are worn.
Check the bearing (Item 13) for wear and looseness. Rotate the bearing while applying pressure to check for pitted or cracked races.
Inspect the oil seal (Item 8) mating surface on the shaft (Item 12) for scoring or wear. If marks on the shaft cannot be removed by light polishing, replace the shaft.

Flow Control Cover (Item 7, Figure 9): Check the relief valve subassembly for free movement in the cover bore. Remove burrs from the valve by polishing, but DO NOT round off the corners of the lands. DO NOT attempt to rework the valve bore. If the bore is damaged, replace the cover.
